DOC.brief_title: Programs To Support You During Chemotherapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To conduct pilot randomize control trial yoga skill training ( YST ) versus care attention control ( AC ) group among 60 adult colorectal cancer ( CRC ) receive chemotherapy determine preliminary efficacy primary outcome fatigue , secondary outcome depressive symptom , possible mediator ( i.e. , psychological stress , circadian disruption , inflammation ) assess standard measure . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To measure impact YST versus AC daily assessment fatigue , depressive symptom , propose mediator trial explore relationship among daily standard assessment . II . To qualitatively assess perceived efficacy YST AC acceptability new methodology semi-structured interview subset 20-40 participant . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 group . GROUP I ( YST ) : Patients participate YST consist four 30 minute in-person yoga session week 2 , 4 , 6 , 8 instructs skill enhance mindfulness promote relaxation , instruction awareness , movement , breathe practice , meditation . GROUP II ( AC ) : Patients participate four 30 minute in-person session supportive conversation week 2 , 4 , 6 , 8 . After completion study , patient follow 4 week .
